item.title: Devolver is Still Trolling Randy Pitchford Over Borderlands 4 Comment
item.description:
Despite having issued an apology, Devolver Digital isn't quick to absolve Randy Pitchford just yet as the publisher continues trolling the Gearbox CEO for his inflammatory $80 Borderlands 4 comment. Set to release on September 12, Borderlands 4 is looking to shake up the series with a new planet named Kairos and a whole set of new playable vault hunters. Despite the controversy, early previews of Borderlands 4 seem to be incredibly positive so far.

Gearbox CEO Randy Pitchford found himself in hot water back in May for responding to a fan who was worried about Borderlands 4 's potential $80 price tag, saying "If you're a real fan, you'll find a way to make it happen." This flippant response to one of gamers' biggest fears during a time of rising game costs caused an uproar online, one that even prompted prominent indie publisher Devolver Digital to take part in. Devolver jabbed on Twitter, saying gamers will be able to buy four copies of its new sci-fi co-op FPS Mycopunk for the price of an $80 Borderlands 4 . Pitchford has since apologized, with Gearbox and 2K subsequently confirming Borderlands 4' s $70 price, allowing gamers to breathe a sigh of relief.

Now, it seems Devolver is using Mycopunk 's release day as an opportunity to take yet another shot at Randy Pitchford. In quote-tweeting its original burn from May 20, Devolver reminded gamers they can buy "4.6 copies" of Mycopunk for the price of Borderlands 4 and used the exact same dollar bill with wings emoji to punctuate the tweet. Devolver's new dig at Pitchford even takes into account Borderlands 4 's confirmed $70 asking price, and doing the math reveals Mycopunk costs just $15 in comparison.

Devolver Takes Another Shot at Gearbox's Randy Pitchford

All the drama aside, these two games actually share quite a lot of similarities in that they're both first-person sci-fi shooters with cell-shaded art styles. With this in mind, Mycopunk seems to be the perfect indie appetizer for Borderlands fans who are looking forward to the series' fourth installment in just about two months. This may be the reason Devolver chose Mycopunk specifically over any of its other games to do this with. If so, it's a clever marketing tactic, and it'll be interesting to see whether it pays off for Mycopunk on Steam over the coming days and weeks.

Borderlands 4 is coming out on September 12 for Xbox, PlayStation, PC, and Nintendo's new Switch 2. Whether Randy Pitchford's bold confidence in the game pays off is yet to be seen, but early signs are pointing towards a very promising release. In the meantime, Mycopunk is out today on PC. Time will tell whether the co-op FPS receives a console release sometime down the road.

item.title: ARK: Aquatica - Release Date Trailer
item.description: ARK: Aquatica, the upcoming expansion DLC for ARK: Survival Evolved, officially announces its release date of July 15, 2025. ARK: Aquatica will be available only on PC.

item.title: 8 Best Games That Let You Figure Things Out On Your Own, Ranked
item.description: A lot of gamers are so done with games that spoon-feed every little hint and detail. It feels patronizing and takes away from the sense of wonder and discovery. It’s not like the idea of helping gamers who struggle is bad, but it’s overdone, and every game feels neutered because of it. Today, we will be ranking our favorite games that take off the training wheels and drop you straight into the action without telling you what to do.

item.title: All King of the Dead Rewards in Black Ops 6 Zombies
item.description:
Black Ops 6's Season 4 Reloaded may not have kicked off with a bang, but players diving into its various modes still have plenty of content to uncover. From the debut of Party Ops in Multiplayer to the Abomination Challenge in Zombies and the many changes made to Grief, there are several unique additions for players to explore.

One of the standout features for Zombies fans is the return of a classic weapon, the Olympia, now available for use in battle. In addition, a new limited-time Zombies-themed event has gone live as part of Season 4 Reloaded. This event gives players a chance to unlock exclusive rewards by competing with others worldwide. Here is a complete guide to everything players need to know about the King of the Dead Event in Black Ops 6 Zombies.

How Does the King of the Dead Event Work in Black Ops 6 Zombies?

Breaking the tradition of previous events in Black Ops 6 , the King of the Dead Event is exclusive to Black Ops 6 Zombies . The event takes the form of a leaderboard-style challenge, tasking players with earning Leaderboard Points by scoring eliminations across any Zombies gamemode.

Each enemy type grants a specific number of Event Points, allowing players to optimize their point gain based on their targets. Completing the main Easter Egg quest for each map also awards players Points , with the amount varying from map to map.

The breakdown is as follows:

  • Zombie Kills: 1 Point
  • Special Zombie Kills: 25 Points
  • Elite Zombie Kills: 100 Points
  • Liberty Falls Quest: 3,500 Points
  • Terminus Quest: 7,500 Points
  • Citadelle Des Morts Quest: 10,000 Points
  • Tomb Quest: 6,000 Points
  • Shattered Veil Quest: 9,000 Points

By earning Points, players progress up the King of the Dead leaderboard, with rewards distributed based on final placement once the event ends. In addition, a separate set of milestone rewards is available by hitting specific Point thresholds, ensuring that every player walks away with something, even if they don’t land a top spot on the leaderboard.

Unsure of what enemies qualify as a Special or Elite Zombie? Check out our dedicated guide here.

All King of the Dead Event Rewards in Black Ops 6 Zombies

The King of the Dead Event rewards in Black Ops 6 Zombies consist entirely of GobbleGums , which are split into two main unlock categories. The first are Leaderboard Rewards , granted after the event concludes on July 17 at 10 AM PT , and are based on your final placement.

Reaching a specific tier unlocks that reward, along with all rewards from the lower tiers. The second category consists of Milestone Rewards , which are tied to earning a set number of Points. These are granted instantly upon reaching the required total.

Here’s a full breakdown of every King of the Dead Event reward:

Leaderboard Rewards:

GobbleGum Reward

Required Leaderboard Placement

1x Cache Back GobbleGum

item.title: Monopoly GO: Waterpark Wonders Rewards and Milestones
item.description:
Monopoly GO is keeping the summer vibes going strong with the Summer Escape album and other minigames. And if things are getting a little too hot, the game has introduced a new solo event called Waterpark Wonders to help you cool off. It started on July 10 and will run for three days and three hours, wrapping up on July 13 , right when Aqua Partners ends.

Just like other solo events during a Partners event, Waterpark Wonders Monopoly GO is your best shot at grabbing lots of tokens for Aqua Partners. You can earn over 3,700 tokens here to help you build those landmarks and get all the big rewards in the minigame. Players will also collect loads of dice, sticker packs, and other goodies as they hit each milestone. Scroll down to see the full list of rewards in the Waterpark Wonders Monopoly GO event.

Waterpark Wonders Monopoly GO Rewards Summary

The Waterpark Wonders solo event is spread over 62 milestones . Every milestone gives you a reward, but some are more special than others. Here are the best rewards available in this Monopoly GO event:

  • 18,205 Dice Rolls
  • 3,780 Tokens for Aqua Partners
  • Final Reward of 5,000 Dice Rolls (62nd Milestone)
  • A 15-Minute Color Wheel Boost at the 44th Milestone
  • A Random Booster at the 11th Milestone
  • A 40-Minute Mega Heist at the 50th Milestone
  • A 15-Minute Builder's Bash at the 18th Milestone
  • A Three-Star Sticker Pack at the 26th Milestone
  • A 15-Minute Cash Grab Boost at the 57th Milestone

Waterpark Wonders Monopoly GO will stay for just three days, so move fast if you want all these amazing rewards.

How to Get Points in Waterpark Wonders Monopoly GO

In the Waterpark Wonders event, Monopoly GO fans don’t need to worry about landing on any specific type of tile. Instead, keep an eye out for the pickup tokens scattered around your board. Every time you land on one, you’ll get 2 points as the base reward.

If you want to score faster, use your multiplier. For example, if your multiplier is set to 10x, you will get 20 points for that landing.
